summary:
Junior chemical engineer with one-year experience in the material science industry (polymers) and two-year experience in customizing and developing advanced solutions (process safety software) for chemical, oil and gas industries. 

Deep knowledge in modeling kinetics and reaction systems for polyamides production.
Basic experience in LNG process simulation and analyses (C3-MR and DMR technologies)
Advanced experience in workflow standardization and automation
Broad experience in software development and database configuration

Most recent achievements:
- Standardize the workflow for the Process Safety Analyser solution. The new procedure was able to read different data-input formats from customers and translate the data into Honeywell applications. As result, the manual work was reduced by 50%. (Honeywell, 2013)
- Development of a new methodology to estimate polymer properties by modeling, using end group approach. This methodology can be used as an alternative for other external software. 

Ability to work in following areas:
- Process design: FEED, project management, conceptual design, detailed engineering, process synthesis, PFD and P&ID generation, mass and energy balance, process integration (mass and energy), PINCH analysis methodology;
- Product design: BOSCARD, Product Driven Process Engineering (PDPE), Fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), House of Quality (HoQ), Decision making process (Six Thinking Hats)
- Process Control: Basic process control in Aspen Dynamics and Simulink.
- Modeling: Polyamide reaction system, multicomponent mixture properties and behavior, Matlab, Mobatec
- LNG production: Business general picture; Cascade process, C3MR, DMR
- Refinery: Atmospheric distillation, vacuum distillation, desulphurisation, CCR Platforming, isomerisation, FCC, hydrocracker. visbreaker
- Honeywell Production Control Center solution: Process Safety Analyzer solution, process documentation, product development and testing

profile_positions.title: Process Risk Analysis Leader & Site engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Plan and execute an individual project to model reaction systems for high temperature polyamides production
- Develop the studied topic in close collaboration with Principle Scientists and Chemists from DSM
- Build a Matlab model for a semi-batch process and refit kinetic parameters based on analytical data sets
- Develop a gProms model for the continuous process and study the process behavior within sensitivity analyses

Achievements
- The estimations of the existing kinetic model was significantly improved by proposing a new approach for the reaction mechanism. With the new mechanism, the model estimations for multiple polymer molecular properties were improved and confirmed with analytical results.
- A new methodology to estimate other polymer properties was developed based on end-group approach. This methodology can be used as potential alternative for other external software.
profile_positions.title: PDEng Trainee

profile_positions.description: Process and Product Design program is directed at the broad field of the process and product industry and aims to prepare its participants for leading functions in the field of process design and knowledge-intensive product development. The program develops the ability to define feasible targets, to identify and acquire the available means, to work in and lead a usually multidisciplinary team. The program lasts for two years and is developed in an international environment, involving people from different cultural and geographical regions. First year consists of intensive trainings given by lecturers from industry and academia. During this year, different work cases are solved in groups, developing and improving the team work strategy and skills of the participants. Second year is spent performing an individual project in industry, on a real business project!
profile_positions.title: Professional Doctorate in Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
- Implement Advanced Solution specific projects by configuring software solutions based on customer site data: Production Control Center® (Transmitter Scout and Production Event Analyzer), Process Safety Analyzer® (Shutdown Analyzer and Safety Valve Scout), Process History Database®, Uniformance Process Studio®
- Set the interface of Honeywell solutions with MS SQL Server and DCS (Honeywell Experion PKS®)
- Test new software solutions and conduct meeting with development team
- Build documentation: Detailed Design Specification (DDS), Factory Acceptance Test (FAT) and SAT Acceptance Test (SAT) documents.

Achievements
- Standardize the workflow for the Process Safety Analyser solution. The new procedure was able to read different data-input formats from customers and translate the data into Honeywell applications. As result, the manual work was reduced by 50%
- Implement the full shutdown logic in Process Safety Analyser solution for two projects (Valemon@Statoil in Norway and ShahGas@Al Hosn Gas in UAE). 
- Participate in updating the Honeywell Romania website to the global pattern. Part of this task I had to collaborate with different business groups and collect specific information about their activity, products and services, but also press releases and contact information
profile_positions.title: MES Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: The main purpose of the association is to keep an engineering community active, to create a friendly social environment and to catalyze the insertion in Dutch culture and industry. The purpose is achieved by organizing different social activities and networking events for the people involved in the Process and Product Design program. Example of activities such as: symposium, evening events, study trips, etc. Chairperson role is to coordinate the committee members, to keep monthly meetings with Process and Product Design program board, to present monthly activity summary to all association members;

Develop and organize the National Contest for high school students “C. D. Neniţescu”, “Politehnica” University of Bucharest.
More details:
http://www.schr.org.ro/
